Package utilities

Class HeapSort

java.lang.Object
utilities.HeapSort
public class HeapSort extends Object
Heap sort is a sorting algorithm where the array is turned into a heap and then rearranged and the node on the heap is deleted from the heap so it can be sorted, in this sort, the smallest is put as the first found so it can be put at the end of the current position of the array

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    (package private) static void
    heapify(Comparable<Shape>[] shapes, int length, int root)
    Sorts the specified array of Shape objects in descending order, according to the natural ordering of its elements.
    (package private) static void
    heapify(Comparable<Shape>[] shapes, int length, int root, Comparator<? super Shape> cmp)
    Sorts the specified array of Shape objects in descending order, according to the natural ordering of its elements.
    static void
    heapSort(Comparable<Shape>[] shapes, Comparator<? super Shape> cmp)
    The entry to heapSort program, determined whether or not to use a heapify algorithm that contains a comparator Goes through every index in order to make the array a heap using heapify Then it one by one extracts the nodes from the heap

  • Constructor Details

    • HeapSort

      public HeapSort()

  • Method Details

    • heapify

      static void heapify(Comparable<Shape>[] shapes, int length, int root)
      Sorts the specified array of Shape objects in descending order, according to the natural ordering of its elements. All elements in the array must implement the Comparable interface.
      Parameters:
      shapes - the array to be sorted
      length - the size of the array being compared for the heap
      root - the index of the array thats being checked with its children if it should be swapped
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the array contains elements that are not mutually comparable

    • heapSort

      public static void heapSort(Comparable<Shape>[] shapes, Comparator<? super Shape> cmp)
      The entry to heapSort program, determined whether or not to use a heapify algorithm that contains a comparator Goes through every index in order to make the array a heap using heapify Then it one by one extracts the nodes from the heap
      Parameters:
      shapes - the array to be sorted
      cmp - the comparator to determine the value being compared of the array

    • heapify

      static void heapify(Comparable<Shape>[] shapes, int length, int root, Comparator<? super Shape> cmp)
      Sorts the specified array of Shape objects in descending order, according to the natural ordering of its elements. All elements in the array must implement the Comparable interface.
      Parameters:
      shapes - the array to be sorted
      length - the size of the array being compared for the heap
      root - the index of the array thats being checked with its children if it should be swapped
      cmp - the comparator to determine the value being compared of the array
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the array contains elements that are not mutually comparable
